page.title: 13TRANSPORT IN CRUWYS MORCHARD
page.content: Our section is crossed by one A road (A373) and minor tarmacadamed roads of 3-6m width with passing places. One market bus on Tuesdays travels through villages to Tiverton and back. There is one daily service on the A373. There are 96 cars, a few households have more than one, some have none. 2 people have bicycles, 6 motorbikes. The nearest petrol station is 5km. It is 18km to Tiverton Junction station, one train stops each way on Sundays and four on weekdays. It is 32km to Exeter St. Davids, a mainline station, 45km to Exeter Airport, 21km to the M5 motorway, 106km to Plymouth and a ferry service to the continent, and 193km to Southampton and the passenger liner terminal. A national coach service operates through Tiverton and a more frequent one from Exeter.
